title: 'The days of taking home just a tan and a photo have gone': Ben Fogle on the secret to a meaningful holiday
text:
TV adventurer Ben Fogle talks about the family holiday he’ll never forget, his love of Alaska, overtourism, and seeing destinations through the eyes of a local.

What do you love most about cruising?

The easy access to numerous destinations. You can reduce the number of flights, ferries or train journeys to get from one place to the other, and you can do that while you’re sleeping. As someone who loves to explore different places, the idea of waking up in a different destination each day is very attractive. A cruise allows people to get the maximum out of their precious holiday time.

You took your family to the Galápagos on Celebrity Flora. What makes the ship so special?

There are many things Celebrity Cruises has installed into Flora that will become the norm for ships. She has solar panels to supplement electricity. There’s no plastic on board, which is a big passion of mine, and they’ve done it well. It’s never a hassle to get water: each room has a fresh-water drinking tap chilled by osmosis, so you’re drinking sea water. It’s brilliant – you can’t taste the difference. My kids loved that Flora has an onboard laboratory and scientific equipment that tracks sea temperatures: all sorts of data is harnessed while you travel, and contributing to our understanding of this very fragile ecosystem. Each day my children spent an hour on-board with a naturalist, looking down microscopes, examining the volcanic rock that they’d collected from the beach.
description: TV adventurer Ben Fogle shares his love of the Galápagos and why he feels passionate about helping his children become responsible travellers
